originalTitle: Russian 'pick-up artist' accused of secretly filming women in Ghana
title: Russian 'pick-up artist' accused of secretly filming women in Ghana
content: Ghana has called on Russia to extradite the man, who is accused of recording sexual encounters without consent.

originalTitle: Planned US-funded baby vaccine trial in Guinea-Bissau blasted by WHO
title: Planned US-funded baby vaccine trial in Guinea-Bissau blasted by WHO
content: Giving some newborns in Guinea-Bissau an established hepatitis B treatment but not others is "unethical", it says.

title: Kenyans drop flowers for Valentine's bouquets of cash. Not everyone is impressed
content: Bouquets of cash have been blooming in popularity in Kenya but recent warnings may slow the trend.

originalTitle: Syrian army takes over al-Shaddadi base after US withdrawal
title: Syrian army takes over al-Shaddadi base after US withdrawal
content: The move, in coordination with the US, is the latest implementation of the ceasefire agreement with Kurdish-led forces.

originalTitle: India hammer Pakistan to qualify for T20 World Cup Super Eights
title: India hammer Pakistan to qualify for T20 World Cup Super Eights
content: Ishan Kishan defies a tricky Colombo pitch with 77 as India beat Pakistan by 61 runs in Group A of the T20 World Cup.

originalTitle: US ‘not disputing’ European assessment of Navalny poisoning, Rubio says
title: US ‘not disputing’ European assessment of Navalny poisoning, Rubio says
content: Secretary of state says Washington will 'not fight' European partners on their findings as UK considers new sanctions.

originalTitle: Iran ready to discuss compromises to reach nuclear deal, minister tells BBC in Tehran
title: Good News! Countries Talk for Peace!
content:
Hello, my wonderful friends all across Africa! It's your friend, Reporter Kojo, here with some happy news from far, far away. Today, we are talking about how grown-ups from different countries are trying to be friends and agree on important things. It's just like when you share your toys with your friends at school, but on a very, very big scale!

Big Countries Talking

Imagine two big countries, like two big families. One country is called Iran, and the other big country is called America. These two countries have been talking for a long time about something very important. They want to make sure everyone in the world is safe and happy. Sometimes, grown-ups talk a lot to find the best way to live together in peace, just like you might talk to your brother or sister to decide who gets to play with the ball first. Did you know? A country is like a very big home for many, many people! Our beautiful Africa has many countries, like Nigeria, Kenya, South Africa, and so many more! Every country has a flag and its own special stories.

What is This Big Talk About?

So, what are they talking about? They are talking about something called 'energy.' Now, energy is a good thing! Energy helps us light our homes, cook our food, and even power our radios so we can listen to music and news. It's like the sun giving us light and warmth every day! We need energy for almost everything we do. But there is a special, very powerful kind of energy. This special energy can be used for good things, like making lots and lots of electricity for towns and cities, so schools and hospitals have lights. But it can also be used in ways that are not good, ways that can be scary if not handled carefully. Think of it like a very, very powerful fire. You can use fire to cook yummy food, but you must be very careful with it, right? You would never play with fire! So, the countries, Iran and America, are talking about how Iran can use this special energy only for good things, like making electricity, and not for anything scary or harmful. This is what we call a 'deal' or an 'agreement.' It means they shake hands and promise to do things in a certain way, like friends making a promise. Did you know? Electricity from energy helps power the streetlights in your town, so it's safer to walk at night, and it charges the phones that let families talk to each other!

Iran Says: 'It's America's Turn!'

Recently, a very important person from Iran, his name is Majid Takht-Ravanchi (that's a long name!), spoke to a news lady. He said that Iran is ready to talk and find a way to agree. He said, 'The ball is in America's court.' What does 'the ball is in America's court' mean? Imagine you are playing a fun game of soccer with your friends. If the ball is in *your* court or on *your* side, it means it's *your* turn to kick the ball! You get to decide what to do next. So, Iran is saying, 'We are ready, now it's America's turn to show they also want to agree and find a happy way forward.' They want America to take the next step in the game of talks. Did you know? When grown-ups in charge of countries talk, we call them 'ministers' or 'leaders.' They work very hard to make sure everyone in their country is safe and healthy, just like a good parent looks after their children.

Why Agreements Are Like Good Friendships

Making agreements is super important, my friends. It's like when you agree with your friend to play nicely and share all your toys. When countries agree, it helps keep the whole world peaceful. When countries are friends and talk, they can help each other. They can share ideas and even help each other build better schools and hospitals. This is called working together, or cooperation. When there is peace and agreement, everyone feels safer and happier. Children can go to school without worry, and families can grow food and build happy homes. This is good for Africa, good for Iran, good for America, and good for every child, everywhere! Peace means everyone can learn, play, and dream big dreams. Did you know? Talking is one of the best ways to solve problems! If you have a problem with a friend, talking calmly helps you understand each other and find a solution, instead of shouting or being sad.

Hopes for the Future

So, now we are waiting to see what America will say and do. We hope that both Iran and America will keep talking and keep trying to be friends. We hope they will find a good agreement so that the special energy is only used for good things, making the world brighter and safer for everyone. Imagine a world where all countries are friends! Just like when you and your friend make up after a little disagreement, it makes everyone feel happy and ready to play again! When big countries agree, it brings hope for a future where all children, like you, can grow up strong, happy, and safe. That's a future we all want. Did you know? The news lady who spoke to the man from Iran works for a very famous news place called the BBC! They tell people all over the world what is happening, so everyone can learn. Let's all hope for more friendly talks and more peace in the world. This is your friend, Reporter Kojo, wishing you a day full of peace and happiness. Bye for now!
summary: Officials from Iran and America are talking about a special kind of energy to make sure it is only used for good things, and Iran hopes America will show they want to agree too so they can make a deal for peace.
whyMatters: This is important because when countries agree to use powerful energy only for good, it helps keep everyone safe and peaceful in the world, making sure children everywhere can grow up happy and without fear, just like good friends share and play nicely.

title: Ukraine's ex-energy minister detained while attempting to leave country
content: His detention comes as he faces legal proceedings after being dismissed in a corruption scandal.

originalTitle: Spurs unstoppable in 10 goal thriller against Aston Villa
title: Spurs unstoppable in 10 goal thriller against Aston Villa
content: Tottenham Hotspur put 7 goals past Aston Villa to keep themselves in the running for a Champions League place.
